BasicDescription.Title: Weather View
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Detailed weather forecast.

BasicDescription.Title: Fame, Set And Match
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Beyond The Fringe: What happened to Oxbridge graduates Alan Bennett, Jonathan Miller, Peter Cook and Dudley Moore after their seminal 1960s satirical revue? Strong language. W/S. [Signed]

Fame Set And Match explores the highs and lows of four heroes of comedy who came to prominence through Edinburgh's Beyond The Fringe review - Peter Cook, Dudley Moore, Alan Bennet and Jonathan Miller. The programme charts the contrasting fortunes of the four, using archive footage and interviews, as well as graphics and animated reconstructions.
The 1960 Edinburgh Festival saw director Robert Ponsonby and his assistant John Basset determined to stage a coup. Previous years had seen the Festival overshadowed by clever undergraduate talent at Edinburgh's more radical Fringe. To try to regain the interest of the audience, Basset picked four talented individuals and created the show that became known as Beyond The Fringe. It would spark off the so-called 'satire boom', changing the nature of comedy forever.
Cambridge graduate Peter Cook was considered the force behind most of the Beyond The Fringe sketches. He went on to team up with Dudley Moore in the massively successful Not Only But Also. Dudley Moore was an organ scholar at Magdalen College Oxford. In 1978, he got the leading role in the film 10, alongside Bo Derek. He then went on to star in the popular Arthur films.
Leeds-born Alan Bennett studied history at Oxford. Though not comfortable working as part of a team, Bennett won acclaim for his clever 'clergyman sketches' at the BBC in the 1960s. Jonathan Miller qualified as a doctor, but has since carved out a career as a satirist, theatre and opera director, medical consultant, sculptor and writer. Miller was knighted this year.

BasicDescription.Title: Life Laundry
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Chris and Antonia both need an office at home and as a result, their two teenage boys have had to share a bedroom. Now the boys have had enough. W/S. [Signed]

Chris Davis and his wife Antonia have been struggling to make best use of their four-bed roomed house since they moved in 10 years ago. With each of them needing an office at home, their two teenage sons have had no choice but to share a bedroom and now they've had enough. But before they can have their own rooms, their parents are forced to shape up and take control of their possessions which have not only overrun the entire house but cost them �15,000 in outside storage.

BasicDescription.Title: Wild Weather
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Donal MacIntyre throws himself into the investigation of extreme weather conditions. W/S. [Signed]

BasicDescription.Title: See Hear
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Lara presents another profile, of ex-See Hear presenter Martin Colville , who talks about his life and work in the Deaf community and chooses his favourite See Hear clips. W/S. [Signed]

RelatedMaterial.PromotionalText:
For a guide to all the signed programmes being broadcast on
the BBC's television channels log on to:

BasicDescription.Title: BBC News 24
BasicDescription.Synopsis: BBC ONE joins the BBC's rolling news channel for a night of news, with bulletins on the hour and the headlines every 15 minutes.

BasicDescription.Title: Breakfast
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Start your day with all the latest news, sport, business and weather from the BBC's Breakfast team. Includes regional news at 25 and 55 minutes past each hour.

BasicDescription.Title: Kilroy
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Robert Kilroy-Silk hosts topical debate and discussion with his studio audience. Followed by BBC News and Weather.

BasicDescription.Title: Ruby
BasicDescription.Synopsis: A lively mix of big name celebrity chat, audience discussion and studio mayhem with Ruby Wax. W/S. Followed by BBC News and Weather.

BasicDescription.Title: Big Strong Boys
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Tenterden Kitchen: Jake and Gavin dip kitchen doors back to bare wood, create a breakfast bar, and improve and focus lighting to make cooking easier.

BasicDescription.Title: Trading Up
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Winterbourne: Gordon Whistance and Hilary Charlewood are in Winterbourne, where they work their magic on an ideal home for today's buyers. W/S. Followed by BBC News And Weather.

BasicDescription.Title: Bargain Hunt
BasicDescription.Synopsis: David Dickinson provides contestants with �200 and an hour at an antiques fair. The experts are on hand to help, but will the items make a profit at auction?

BasicDescription.Title: Wipeout
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Bob Monkhouse hosts the humorous general knowledge quiz, where if you know the subject it's easy but if you don't, wipeout awaits.

BasicDescription.Title: BBC News
BasicDescription.Synopsis: The latest national and international news from the BBC this lunchtime, including Weather.

BasicDescription.Title: BBC London News
BasicDescription.Synopsis: The latest stories from the BBC London newsroom.

BasicDescription.Title: Neighbours
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Michelle and Connor explore ways of getting Connor to the States. Lou and Harold get used to living alone and apart. Do Kev and Ange have the winning numbers?

BasicDescription.Title: Diagnosis Murder
BasicDescription.Synopsis: The Unluckiest Bachelor In LA: Steve finds the girl of his dreams, but she is killed in a hit and run accident days later. Dr Sloan's line of investigation leads him to suspect the girl's brother.

BasicDescription.Title: As Time Goes By
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Lionel extends to Jean the offer of a free holiday, but her response isn't as he imagined.

BasicDescription.Title: Fimbles
BasicDescription.Synopsis: CBeebies. Box Of Coins: When Fimbo finds three shiny coins, he wants to buy something with them. The others love the coins, and they each give Fimbo something special in return for them.

BasicDescription.Title: Woody Woodpecker
BasicDescription.Synopsis: CBBC. Signed, Sealed And Delivered/Out To Launch/Spa Spa Blackbird: Woody goes to pick up a package, Winnie tries to save the world and then Woody visits a Spa.

BasicDescription.Title: Mona The Vampire
BasicDescription.Synopsis: CBBC. The Dastardly Dr Voodoo: Mona is a ten year old girl who revels in the icky and eerie - when there's a ghoulish mystery to be solved she becomes Mona The Vampire.

BasicDescription.Title: Stacey Stone
BasicDescription.Synopsis: CBBC. Football Crazy: Matt gets his big break when football scouts want him to trial for the School Boys' team. Will Jo's horoscope predictions come true?

BasicDescription.Title: CBBC At The Fame Academy
BasicDescription.Synopsis: CBBC. Get the latest from the Fame Academy where the students compete to win the biggest prize money can't buy.

BasicDescription.Title: Blue Peter
BasicDescription.Synopsis: CBBC. Matt Baker, Konnie Huq, Liz Barker and Simon Thomas report from across the UK and the world. With celebrity guests, music, sport, food, and a whole lot more.

BasicDescription.Title: Newsround
BasicDescription.Synopsis: CBBC. Daily news magazine keeping you up to date on the latest stories and events happening at home and abroad.

BasicDescription.Title: BBC News
BasicDescription.Synopsis: The latest national and international news from the BBC. Includes a weather summary.

BasicDescription.Title: BBC London News
BasicDescription.Synopsis: The latest stories from the BBC London newsroom. Followed by the national headlines and Weather.

BasicDescription.Title: Watchdog
BasicDescription.Synopsis: The Watchdog team takes a stand on behalf of consumers, tackling your problems live on air, exposing high street scandals and conducting investigations.

BasicDescription.Title: Wallace And Gromit's...
BasicDescription.Synopsis: ...Cracking Contraptions. The Turbo Diner: Gromit's disdain for clearing the kitchen table leads to another arresting invention from Wallace.

BasicDescription.Title: Best Inventions
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Katy Hill and Rowland Rivron introduce three international inventors with their inventions, which are competing to be voted by BBC viewers as the Best Invention.

Britain is a nation of inventors, without whom, there would be no television or telephone, but how does the rest of the world compare? The show also features Art Fry, the man who invented the Post-it note.
Katy Hill and Rowland Rivron host the live show that sees three international inventors attempt to persuade a panel of experts, including inventors Trevor Bayliss and Michelle Mone, their invention is the best. But will their product stand up to the rigorous testing by the studio audience?
It's up to the viewers to vote for the best invention, by calling 09011-902202. [Calls cost 10 pence].

BasicDescription.Title: National Lottery Midweek Draws
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Join Eamonn Holmes for the all important midweek Lotto, Lotto Extra and Thunderball draws.

BasicDescription.Title: Animal Hospital
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Tiger Lilly has to have her tail removed after a dramatic cat fight. A marmoset monkey needs a new home. Jamie Darling helps to remove a stranded pony from a field that is flooding fast.

BasicDescription.Title: Alistair McGowan's Big Impression
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Christmas Special: Alistair McGowan and Ronni Ancona serve up a festive feast of everyone's favourite faces from the world of showbiz, sport and soap.

BasicDescription.Title: The Life Of Mammals
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Chisellers: David Attenborough explores how rodents, the most numerous mammals on the planet, live. He shows how they use their chisel-sharp, front teeth to survive.

Rodents like rats, mice and squirrels are the most numerous mammals on the planet. With their constantly growing, chisel-sharp front teeth, they are specialists in breaking into seeds. In Panama, David Attenborough fails to smash open a tropical nut with a large rock, but the terrier-sized Agouti can easily gnaw through the concrete-hard casing to get at the nutritious kernel inside.
Like several rodents, the desert kangaroo rat stuffs seeds into its cheek pouches to take back to its burrow for safer eating, while the strange looking naked mole-rat lives its entire life underground, using its massive incisors for digging tunnels and ripping apart buried tubers for food.
Beavers can even cut down trees with their front teeth, using the logs for building their dams and lodges. A tiny infra-red camera inserted into a beavers' lodge shows how they stay active during winter, feeding on the leaves and branches they have stored under the ice in Autumn. But unknown visitors also revealed themselves on camera - a family of muskrats sharing the lodge - tolerated perhaps in exchange for a regular supply of fresh bedding for the beavers!
Rodents are known for being prolific breeders, as in Australia, causing such plagues that farmlands and homes are literally overrun by carpets of mice. The largest rodents in the world, Capybara, also occur in huge numbers, but they live in the vast swampy grasslands of South America, so there's plenty of room to graze in great herds.
BasicDescription.PromotionalInformation: BBC Book: The Life of Mammals Part 1, David Attenborough

BasicDescription.Title: BBC News At Ten O'Clock
BasicDescription.Synopsis: National and international news, with reports from BBC correspondents worldwide.

BasicDescription.Title: BBC London News
BasicDescription.Synopsis: The latest stories from the BBC London newsroom.

BasicDescription.Title: Under Siege
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Only one man can stop two ruthless military specialists from stealing the nuclear arsenal of a hijacked battleship. Stars Steven Seagal and Tommy Lee Jones. Violence and strong language. W/S. [1992]

Explosive thriller starring Steven Seagal and Tommy Lee Jones.
The Pacific Ocean. The USS Missouri, the US Navy's biggest battleship, is hijacked by two ruthless military specialists, intent on stealing its lucrative nuclear arsenal. With millions of lives hanging in the balance, only one man stands in their way - Casey Ryback, a ship's cook and former Navy SEAL. [1992]
Casey Ryback ...... Steven Seagal William Strannix ...... Tommy Lee Jones Commander Krill ...... Gary Busey Jordan Tate ...... Erika Eleniak Captain Adams ...... Patrick O'Neal Tom Breaker ...... Nick Mancuso Admiral Bates ...... Andy Romano Daumer ...... Colm Meaney Flicker ...... David McKnight
